name: Deploy Static Site to GitHub Pages

# Trigger the workflow on push to the 'main' branch
on:
  push:
    branches:
      - main

jobs:
  deploy:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest  # Specify the OS that will run the actions

    steps:
      # Step 1: Checkout the code from the repository
      - name: Checkout code
        uses: actions/checkout@v2

      # Step 2: Set up Node.js environment (needed for the JS linter)
      - name: Set up Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v2
        with:
          node-version: '14'  # You can choose any compatible Node.js version

      # Step 3: Install dependencies (ESLint, etc.)
      - name: Install dependencies
        run: npm install

      # Step 4: Run the JS linter (ESLint)
      - name: Run JS linter
        run: npm run lint  # This runs ESLint as defined in your package.json

      # Step 5: Build and deploy to GitHub Pages
      - name: Build and deploy to GitHub Pages
        uses: JamesIves/github-pages-deploy-action@v4
        with:
          branch: gh-pages  # This is where the site will be deployed (GitHub Pages branch)
          folder: .         # Root folder of your site (use './' if everything is at the root)
